Name: amname
column6: name of the access method

Name: amstrategies
column6: number of operator strategies for this access method, or zero if access method does not have a fixed set of operator strategies

Name: amsupport
column6: number of support routines for this access method

Name: amcanorder
column6: does the access method support ordered scans?

Name: amcanunique
column6: does the access method support unique indexes?

Name: amcanmulticol
column6: does the access method support multicolumn indexes?

Name: amoptionalkey
column6: does the access method support a scan without any constraint for the first index column?

Name: amindexnulls
column6: does the access method support null index entries?

Name: amsearchnulls
column6: does the access method support is null searches?

Name: amstorage
column6: can index storage data type differ from column data type?

Name: amclusterable
column6: can an index of this type be clustered on?

Name: aminsert
column6: "insert this tuple" function

Name: ambeginscan
column6: "start new scan" function

Name: amgettuple
column6: "next valid tuple" function

Name: amgetmulti
column6: "fetch multiple tuples" function

Name: amrescan
column6: "restart this scan" function

Name: amendscan
column6: "end this scan" function

Name: ammarkpos
column6: "mark current scan position" function

Name: amrestrpos
column6: "restore marked scan position" function

Name: ambuild
column6: "build new index" function

Name: ambulkdelete
column6: bulk-delete function

Name: amvacuumcleanup
column6: post-vacuum cleanup function

Name: amcostestimate
column6: function to estimate cost of an index scan

Name: amoptions
column6: function to parse and validate reloptions for an index
